javanews.events.gui
Class HelpMenu

java.lang.Object
  javanews.events.gui.HelpMenu
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class HelpMenu
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

Listens for events corresponding to any of the three items in the Help menu. An identifier is used to recognise exactly which type of event is being generated.

Version:
1.000
Author:
Alex Harris (email: Alexander.J.Harris(at)btinternet.com)

 void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
          The event generate is compared against the button to which it is attached and the appropriate Help window is shown in the GUI.

Constructor Detail

HelpMenu

public HelpMenu(java.lang.String identifier)
Creates a new instance of the class. As this class can be used to respond to any one of 3 distinct events the supplied identifier allows us to recognise which event should be triggered.

The events supported by this class are:

  • Help > About
  • Help > Using
  • Help > Licensing

Parameters:
identifier - The string identifier of the event to be attached to. This should be in lower case.
Method Detail

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
The event generate is compared against the button to which it is attached and the appropriate Help window is shown in the GUI.

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
Parameters:
e - The event generated by the user.
